abstract.text: The component for displaying a thumbnail image with an article link.

, VoiceOver uses the

An object that defines vertical alignment with another component.
An object that defines an animation you apply to the component.
Use the
value for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.
The identifier of the article that this component displays the thumbnail of. By default the
value is inherited from the
component.
The aspect ratio of the component in which the article thumbnail is displayed.
An object that defines behavior for a component, like
or
Use the
value for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.
A caption that describes the image. The article displays this text when the image is full screen, and VoiceOver uses this text if you don’t provide
text. For more information about VoiceOver, see the
page in Accessibility. The caption text doesn’t appear in the main article view. To display a caption in the main article view, use the
component.
An instance or array of component properties that you can apply conditionally, and the conditions that cause Apple News Format to apply them.
A Boolean that indicates that the image may contain explicit content.
A string that indicates how to display the image fill.
Valid values:
(default). Scales the image by aspect ratio to completely fill the component.
. Scales the image by aspect ratio to fit the component.
A Boolean that indicates whether the component is hidden.
A string that sets the horizontal alignment of the image fill within its component.
Valid values:
. Aligns the left edge of the fill with the left edge of the component.
(default). Aligns the horizontal center of the fill with the center of the component.
. Aligns the right edge of the fill with the right edge of the component.
You can use
with
to achieve the effect you want. For example, set
to
and
to
to fit the image based on its aspect ratio and align the left edge of the fill with the left edge of the component. Or set
to
and
to right to scale the image horizontally and align the right edge of the fill with the right edge of the component.

A unique identifier for this component. If you use identifier, it must be unique across the entire document. Apple News requires an identifier if you want to anchor other components to this component. See
An inline
object that contains layout information, or a string reference to a
object that’s defined at the top level of the document.
If you don’t define
, Apple News bases size and position on various factors, such as the device type, the length of the content, and the
of this component.
An inline
object that defines the appearance of this component, or a string reference to a
object that’s defined at the top level of the document.
Use the
value for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.
The URL of an image file.
If omitted, the thumbnail of the article referenced in the
component is used. Images should be high-resolution so they can be smoothly scaled down.
Image URLs can begin with http://, https://, or bundle://. If the image URL begins with bundle://, the image file must be in the same directory as the document.
Image filenames should be properly encoded as URLs.
See
A string that defines the vertical alignment of the article thumbnail within the component.
Use the
object to display the thumbnail of an article. Use this component inside an
component. The value of the
property is automatically populated to reference the thumbnail image associated with the article (using the
property of the

abstract.text: Add a scene to your article to create special effects.

doc://com.apple.applenews/documentation/.title: Adding a Scene to a Chapter or a Section Header

abstract.text: Link to an article by using the article-linking container component.
Configure a side-by-side, horizontal arrangement of components for your article.
Use container components to create the component hierarchies you need for special article designs.
Add media assets to your article.

doc://com.apple.applenews/documentation/.title: Preparing Image, Video, Audio, Music, and ARKit Assets

abstract.text: Get Apple News Format reference information, and create signature content for Apple News.
The object for anchoring one component to another component in your article’s layout.
The container component for creating a link to an article.
The component for displaying a thumbnail image with an article link.
The component for setting apart content that is not directly related to the article, such as promotional content.
Properties shared by all the behaviors you can use to affect how components react to device motion and scrolling.
The component for adding caption text.
The object you use in image components for displaying captions when the image is full-screen.
The component for organizing an article into chapters.
An object used in any container component type to define how the collection of child components is presented.
Properties shared by all component types.
Properties that all types of animations share.
The object for defining the positioning for a specific component within the article’s column system.
The component addition object for making a component interactive and opening a link to another location in News.
The object for setting style properties for components, including background color and fill, borders, and table styles.
The object for defining conditional properties for a component, and when the conditional properties are in effect.
Properties shared by all container types.
The component for defining a horizontal line to visually divide parts of your article.
The component for redistributing empty space inside a horizontal stack collection.
The component for defining the top area of an article, chapter, or section.
The object for displaying components side by side in a Container component.
The component for displaying JPEG, WebP, PNG, or GIF images.
The behavior whereby a component moves at a speed different from the scroll speed.
The component for organizing an article into sections.
The patterns supported for article identifiers in UUID format.
